summary: Email correspondence between a U.S. Attorney's Office prosecutor and French individuals regarding scheduling a call for the ongoing SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell. The prosecutor seeks to speak with Nicolas Cassart and Nicolas Boulay.

persons.name: Nicolas Cassart
persons.context: French individual whom SDNY prosecutors are attempting to contact for a call regarding the Epstein/Maxwell investigation. He responds to schedule a meeting.

persons.name: Nicolas Boulay
persons.context: Copied on the email exchange, described as the partner of Nicolas Cassart, and also available for the scheduled call with SDNY prosecutors.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject of the ongoing SDNY investigation referenced in the email.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the subject of the ongoing prosecution being handled by the SDNY prosecutors.

connections.description: Referred to as partners in the email correspondence from Cassart.
SDNY prosecutors are seeking to speak with Cassart as part of their investigation into Epstein.
SDNY prosecutors are seeking to speak with Cassart as part of their prosecution of Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled call between SDNY and French contacts
events.description: A call is scheduled for Friday, March 5, 2021, at 17:00 (French time) between SDNY prosecutors and Nicolas Cassart and Nicolas Boulay.

keyFacts: The SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell was ongoing as of March 2021.
SDNY prosecutors were actively seeking to interview foreign nationals, specifically Nicolas Cassart and Nicolas Boulay in France, as part of the investigation.
The email exchange shows coordination to schedule an international call, indicating the investigation had an international scope.
The document is a routine scheduling email, revealing no substantive details about the nature of Cassart's and Boulay's potential knowledge or involvement.
